byline.contributor: Carlotta Gall reported from Tunis, and Steven Erlanger from London.
byline.original: By CARLOTTA GALL and STEVEN ERLANGER

abstract: Tunisian officials reveal that Seifeddine Rezgui, gunman who killed 38 foreign tourists at beachside hotel, had trained with extremist group in Libya earlier in 2015; note that Chelli's training coincided with that of two gunmen who later killed 22 people in March at the National Bardo Museum in Tunis.
lead_paragraph: The man who killed 38 people last week had spent time in a militant camp in Libya, overlapping with two men who killed 22 in March, security officials said Tuesday.

headline.main: Gunman at Tunisian Beach Hotel Trained With Museum Attackers
headline.print_headline: Gunmen in 2 Tunisia Raids Trained Together in Libya

snippet: The man who killed 38 people last week had spent time in a militant camp in Libya, overlapping with two men who killed 22 in March, security officials said Tuesday.
